1.content:
So, this is the first chapter of my interactive. It was a hard time deciding how to format this page. I was stuck between creating scenarios for readers to add to, or leave everything blank and let user creativity flow. In the end, i came up with a sort of compromise.

Below you are fie choices for the rest of the interactive. The first choice will direct you to stories pertaining to the Pokemon Anime, and will focus along the lines of Misty, May, Dawn and etcetera.

The second choice will direct you to stories pertaining about the Pokemon Core Games like Red & Blue, Black & White, and will focus around the female protagonists like Leaf or Hilda.

The third choice will direct you to stories that revolve around the Pokemon spin off games like Colosseum, Ranger, or Conquest. Those stories will focus on the likes of the female characters like Summer from Guardian Signs or the Heroine form conquest.

The fourth choice will take you to chapters about the Pokemon Manga. I must confess, I don't have an extensive education of the Manga cannon, but I wanted to add this choice for the people who do.

And finally, the fifth choice. This choice will direct you to stories solely based on the interests of the author. Is the above options too constricting for you? Do you want a story based around a Nurse Joy, and officer Jenny, or a gym leader? Do you want to write something that’s in the Pokemon Universe, but doesn't really fit with any of the cannon? This is the choice for you.

Thank you for taking the time to read my Interactive. I hope you will come back for more and add stories to this particular little niche.
1.title: The First Chapter

11.content:
You have chosen the Anime section of the Interactive. Have you ever wanted to see what Ash’s journey through the Pokemon World would look like if all the female characters were sadistic mile high blobs? Than you have come to the right place.

Below you are options for which series of the Anime you would like to start in. It doesn't have to start in Kanto like the original series. Maybe you want to see Iris boss Ash around instead if Misty, or Serena, or May.

And mind you, I will tolerate extreme leniency of the show’s cannon. Such as, Ash’s mother Delia coming along with him on his journey, or Pokémon are not as strong as they are in the show. Just be sure to explain the differences to the reader accurately.
11.title: Anime Stories

111.content:
Somewhere in Pallet Town, even though the night was already getting late into the evening, a young boy by the name of Ash Ketchum was still up and about in his room.

The boy wore a cap that was red and white with an opened beak-like symbol. He donned a blue and white vest jacket with a black shirt and a pair of blue jeans. On his hand, Ash wore green finger less gloves.

As if right now, Ash was watching a Pokemon battle between two elite trainers. ‘Now that I am ten, I can finally get my Pokemon License. I will journey to gain the wisdom of Pokemon Training, and I hereby declare to the Pokemon of the world, I will become A Pokemon Master!” Ash thought in his head as he grabbed a clock that resembled a Voltorb and held it proudly in his hand as if he was holding a real Pokeball. That was until…

“Ash! Go to sleep!”

When he heard that feminine balance, Ash lost his balance and his grip on his clock, accidentally tossing it towards the door. The door, however, was opened just in time for a pudgy hand to catch it mid air. The clock split open, showing the 12 numbers inside and a cuckoo pidgey. “It’s eleven O’clock and you should be asleep!”

It was Delia Ketchum, the mother of the young Ash. Like most other women, Delia was an obese women. Her thick, fat, yet powerful arms were crossed over her bosom, making the impossibly large orbs that were already bigger than Delia’s head appear even more bloated. The two mammaries rested on a yoga ball sized stomach that predicted several feet out from her frame. Her whole heavy body was supported by strong, yet pillowy pillars for legs, while her huge upper body weight was balanced out by two buttocks that smooshed both ends of the doorway she was standing in.

Ash cringed as his mother entered his doorway. Males in society were often treated as weak toys. You couldn't tell underneath all of that blubber, but most women are incredibly strong, in some absurd medical condition where fat equated to muscle. Ash was more often than not berated and sat on by his mother, but he knew better than to get too uppity about it.

“But tomorrow is the day that i begin my Pokemon Journey. I can’t sleep” Ash whined. One of the reasons he wanted to go on his journey so soon was that he wanted to get as far away from his home as possible. Being Delia Ketchum’s son is a chore, to put it lightly. He couldn't wait until he could taste freedom and train with his Pokemon.

Delia scowled and sighed. She stepped into her son’s room, making the floorboards under the creak from the weight. She snatched the television remote from on top of Ash’s bed and changed the channel on the television. “If you can’t sleep, you should at least get ready for tomorrow. Here, watch Professor Oak’s lecture.”

The channel on the television monitor from the match that Ash was watching to the Pallet Town's Pokemon Laboratory with Professor Samuel Oak standing in front of the camera and a board behind him with pictures of Charmander, Bulbasaur and Squirtle. "Good evening Pallet Town!” He started. ”Tomorrow's the big day for the newest class of Pokémon students. I'd like to introduce you to Bulbasaur, Charmander and Squirtle." He pointed to the three pictures of the Pokémon he just said and he continued. "Each one is available for new trainees. Which one shall you choose?"

"Alright, when this is over this I want you to go to bed, understand?," Ash's mother reminded as she headed out of the room.

Ash, still engrossed with the show, grumbled. "Alright. I'm going."

His mother left the room with another sigh and continued. "Make sure you change into your pajamas too."

"I'm going to do that," Ash replied as his door closed. An hour later, Ash was already on his bed, fast asleep, dreaming of the Pokémon he would get the next day. "Raising Bulbasaur...might be rather simple. It's perfect...for beginners," Ash muttered. "Then there's Squirtle..." At that moment, his Voltorb clock fell onto his hand. "Choose it or lose it...hold on, Charmander...those in the 'no' say that's the best way to go..."

Morning soon came as a Dodrio stood on the top of a house's rooftop and screeched (like a rooster).

"I choose you, Charmander!" Ash cried out unconsciously as he tossed his clock at the wall, while he's asleep no less. As soon as the clock crashed and broke, Ash instantly jerked up and gasped as sweat poured down his face. Then, he looked towards the window and his eyes widened. "Oh no! What time is it?!" The young soon-to-be Pokémon Trainer scrambled out of his bed and fell onto the ground.

"Oh no, no, no, no! I'm LATE!" Ash shrieked as he got to his feet and rushed out of his room.

He ran down the stairs, jumping the last few steps to save time, before putting on his shoes and dashing out of the house. "Oh...I hope there's still a Pokémon left for me...Squirtle, Bulbasaur, Charmander. Any of those will be fine, just save one for me, professor!"
111.title: Original Series (Indigo League)

choices: Ash And Pikachu Make It Outside Pallet Town
Something Comes Up Before They Can Leave
1112.content:
“A-Are you sure there are no other Pokemon?" Ash asked Professor Oak looking down at the short, chubby rodent Pokémon covered in yellow fur. Professor Oak nervously rubbed the back of his head as a bead of sweat made its way down his forehead. Ash made it a whole hour late to the Laboratory in his pajamas, and all the other Pokemon had been taken by the early birds.

The Pikachu sitting down on the table in front of the two humans chirped curiously as it tilted it's had slightly to the left. It's plump red electric pouches sparkled with electricity as it eyed the ten year old Ash; was this supposed to be it's trainer? He looks like he's ready to go to bed, not care of the Pokemon.

"Well Ash, I would have given you a regular starter, if you hadn't overslept through the whole ceremony. You really should be grateful you are getting a Pokemon at all."

"I know, I know!" Ash almost shouted in defense. "It's just...it doesn't look like it likes me..."

"Piiiiii..." Pikachu growled in agreement.

"Well Ash, you are a total stranger to it. You can't expect to be friends with every Pokemon you come across. It just needs time to get used to you." Professor Oak said sagely. Ash grimaced but reluctantly nodded. It was going to be tough, but he mentally promised himself that he and the Pikachu will be friends. He held the Pikachu's Pokeball in one hand while the other cautiously tried to pet the yellow rodent's head.

"Pikaaaa!" Pikachu growled as the human's hands gently stoked the top of his head. Soon, however, the growls died out were replaced with muted chirps of pleasure as Ash scratched his sweet spot near the base of his ears.

"See? There's hope for you two yet!" Professor Oak praised, not believing that he was able to calm down the Pikachu with simple petting. He was expecting the grumpy Pokemon to electrocute the young boy, and he even had a whole bad pun ready for it. "Oh, before you leave, there are two things you need. First, your Pokedex." Professor Oak grabbed a red device out of his coat pocket and gave it to Ash.

"Second, some advice. This Pikachu absolute detests going into its Pokeball, so you are going to have to find a way to carry him outside."

"Well, that doesn't sound too bad..." Ash stopped petting Pikachu and put it's pokeball in his pajama pocket for later. He held out both hands in front of his abdomen, gently motioning to the Pokemon to hop in. Pikachu puffed his chest and looked away, but eventually was won over by Ash's pleading face. The slightly less moody Pokemon hopped into Ash's arms...and gave him a tiny shock.

"Youch!" Ash winced in pain. "What was that for?" He looked down to the yellow rodent, who only offered a smug grin, satisfied with the expression in his new trainer's face.

"Shocking, is it not?" Professor Oak chuckled at his own bad pun, happy that he was able to use his joke after all.


Then all hell broke loose.

"ASH!" The three heard a shrill, deafening voice boom from the outside of the Pokemon Laboratory. Then, the front door to Professor Oak's home slash workplace busted out of its hinges as Delia Ketchum's fat body stormed into the foyer. Ash cringed as he shuffled nervously behind the Pokemon Professor, who also was visible afraid.

"Where the hell are you, ya little worthless shit?!" Delia screeched as her fat body wobbled up and down and left to right, running into the main laboratory where Oak and Ash was. Pikachu growled angrily as he heard the upset women enter the room. He would have jumped out and attacked the women if it wasn't for Oak blocking the way,

A-aah! Delia, what a pleasant surprise!" Professor Oak nervously meeped. "A-are you here to see your son go off on his Pokemon Journey?". The Pokemon Professor asked, hopeful that she would leave as soon as possible.

"That fucking fag isn't going anywhere!" Delia screeched at the poor soul. "He forgot to make me breakfast and left me all alone, waiting for my food!" Ash deadpanned as he realized that he was in such a rush to get his Pokemon, that he forgot to make breakfast for himself, and more importantly, his mom.

Delia pushed the professor aside and was about to grab his son by his hair all the way back to the house, when she eyed the yellow Pokemon sitting in his arms. "Well..." Delia smirked. "It look like you got your Pokemon Ash~. Well, since you went out of your way to get me such a rare Pokemon, I'll let this slide just this once."

Before he could even offer a peep of protest, Pikachu was snatched out of Ash's arms and held him up above her head." I don't think I ever had a Pokemon like you before! Well, it won't matter anyway, soon all you will be is-"

Delia was cut off in the middle off her sentence as Pikachu let out a powerful electric attack against her. Her whole body was covered in a plume of yellow energy, flashed from black to white as her skeleton shined through her charred flesh. At the end of the ordeal, Delia was left covered in burn marks, slowly collapsing to her feet from exhaustion. Not before Pikachu hopped out of her grip and into Ash's arms once again.

Ash and Professor Oak were in awe of what just happened. Usually, electric attacks were powerless against human females, because their fat was too thick for them to hurt. But Pikachu...this Pikachu was able to not only hurt Ash's abusive mother, but knock her out in one go. Pikachu merely licked his fur back in place from when the fat human gripped him so hard.

"Uhhh..." Professor Oak offered to the situation. "Why don't you two start your Pokemon Journey? Don't worry, I'll be fine! I'll find a way to deal with...this..."

Ash slowly walked around his still unconscious mother, twitching in her sleep, and walked out of the busted doorway of the Pokemon laboratory out to the beginning of his Pokemon Journey. It was certainly going to be interesting.
1112.title: Ash Gets There Late

11121.content:
Ash had left Pallet Town onto Route 1, already having a rather interesting morning with his new Pokémon. The yellow rodent he carried in his hands, Ash not even attempting to put him in his Pokeball, had electrocuted his mother to the point of collapse, no small feet for someone as fat as her.

Pikachu merely licked his paw as his human trainer carried him against his chest. He was starting to warm up to his apparent master. Granted, they were nowhere near friends, but Pikachu realized that he might have seized the kid up too quickly. At this point, most trainers would have tried to force him into his Pokeball, and he secretly sympathized with him for having to live with such a loud and vulgar women.

Ash continued to hold Pikachu in his arms as they made it far past out Pallet Town. If he had known that a Pikachu this strong was with Oak this whole time, he would have slept in on purpose. It was a well known fact that women were stronger than most Pokemon, their fat and flesh absorbed all attacks and strengthened their own.

And Pikachu knocked out one of the fattest women in Pallet Town with one attack.

Ash felt lucky to have Pikachu by his side, but he was disheartened that he still was abrasive towards him. Hopefully that would change soon. As they continued to trek along Route 1, they eventually made their way into its forested section.

“Alright, this looks like a good enough place to rest.” Ash notes as he examined a clearing near the path. Pikachu hopped down from Ash’s arms and scratched his ear dismissively. Ash smiled and reached into his backpack to take out the lunch be prepared, only to realize he had made a grave mistake.

In his excitement to go on his Pokémon journey, and in the confusion that transpired at the lab, Ash had forgot to pick up the free six Pokeballs provided to him. Ash gulped, coming to terms with the fact that he had no way to catch other Pokemon.

“Chu…” Pikachu cried lowly, impatient for his lunch. Ash sighed and took out the food from his backpack: a thermos of stew and a bowl of Poke chow. However, the moment Ash had twisted the cap off to take a sip, the scent of cooked food alerted another being to their presence.

Ash and Pikachu heard rustling in the bushes, and turned in it’s direction to see...
11121.title: Ash And Pikachu Make It Outside Pallet Town

choices: Delia tries to eat all the Spearow
The Spearow are too much, time to flee!
A redhead comes to rescue them
111213.content:
Family.

No one can ever really escape from it. No matter how far you go, no matter how much you distance yourself, they still have a hold over you for better or worse. Ash thought when he finally turned ten years of age and he would get his first Pokemon, he would be able to go on his Journey and be free of his mother’s possessive abuse forever, leaving Pallet Town and never looking back.

But Ash was wrong because no one can ever really get away from family. And in his case, it was more literal than most. The well-aged foliage around his makeshift rest site was suddenly trampled down and parted as his mother, Delia, invaded it. Her body was now stark nude after his Pikachu had electrocuted the cloth to smoke, with some smudges of ash here and they're on her body. Her son was more or less accustomed to seeing her stark nude, but Pikachu uncomfortably averted his gaze as she revealed herself.

“Hello there, Ashy~”. Delia greeted her son with a smug smile, to which Ash dropped his jaw from shock. “That Pokemon of yours really packs a punch, huh? Well, it’s no matter now. I hope you had fun playing trainer, because you’re coming right back home with me, mister!”

“N...N-no!” Ash clenched his fists and started definitely at Delia with years pent up rage. Pikachu quickly made his way in front of his new master in an effort to protect him. “I-I’m not going back with you, because I have my own Pokemon now! I’d rather die than spend another minute in that house!”

Delia blinked, a bit stunned. Ash had never stood up to her before, making for the perfect ragdoll and servant for her. At first, she was immensely angry that he had the fucking nerve to snap back at her, but then his words started to sink in. He would rather die than go back with her. The mother part of her took a blow to that statement, even if he was exaggerating it. She looked down at the scrawny Pikachu that managed to knock her out, and then back up at her son.

“...Alright, Ash.” Delia sighed in defeat, eliciting a shocked gasp from Ash. “You want to go on a Pokemon Journey so bad...I won’t stop you.”

“R-really?” Ash questioned, not believing the words that were coming out of Delia’s mouth. “W-wow...thank you, mom, I guess.”

“But,” Delia suddenly walked forward, closing in the distance between herself and her son. “If I can’t stop you from going on a Pokemon Journey, then you can’t stop me from tagging along~.”

“Wha...what!?” Ash exclaimed loudly as his eyes widened. “No no no, not a chance in-” He stopped himself mid-sentence to back himself up a few steps and Delia kept walking forward with an evil smirk on her face, walking over Pikachu with ease. The yellow rodent starts to charge up his electricity in case of an attack, the sound of energy crackling in the air well present in his trainer’s mother’s ears.

But Delia just kept closing the distance, eventually pushing her son back into a tree as her naked, jiggly belly pressed up against his weak torso, only leaving him enough room to get some shallow breaths of air into his lungs. “It’s either that or coming home with me, sweetie-pie~”. She cooed with icy venom, before suddenly pushing off his body to give him some air, only to slam back into him hard enough to skate the leaves off of the tree. “What’s your choice?”

A small puff of air from Ash’s mouth is the only way Delia’s son could protest such treatment. “Alright, alright! You can come with me, just get off of me, please!”

“Only because you said the magic word.” Delia purred before slowly getting off of her son. Ash stands back up on his feet slowly, stretching his shoulders back to rid the soreness that grew there. Inhaling and exhaling as his lungs returned to his normal state, he looked up to his mother Delia, casting an ominous shadow over him with her nude, fat body. He had grown relatively accustomed to the many crushing and squashings his mother dolled out, but it still left him in pain afterward. It was just routine, and to his dismay, it would STAY routine as she would accompany him on his journey throughout Kanto. Pikachu, having seen that his master was fine, went back to impatiently demanding some food for his hungry stomach.

“Pikachu!” The yellow rodent Pokemon scowled and pointed to his belly for emphasis. Delia looked back at him, and then to Ash with a hungry look in her eyes.

“Oh yes, I almost forgot. You didn't get to serve me breakfast earlier. How silly of you.” Delia rubbed her bloated, wrecking ball of a gut. “Well, I suppose you can make it up to me by making some for me now.”

Ash fed Pikachu his well earned Poke-Chow, while Delia in her vast hunger devoured everything edible in her son's supplies. With no more food and her mother still hungry, Ash had to halt his Pokemon Journey to find more food for her in the forest. The woodland was actually quite crowded with wild Pokemon, but with no other Pokeballs, he had no way of catching any of them. Meanwhile, Delia helped herself to the apparent buffet the land provided for her by happily slurping down any stray creature that crept out from the tall grass. Ash grimaced as he watched her down a whole family of Ratata with ease and room for more, while Pikachu was just outright pissed. He was about to shock her into a comatose state once again, but Ash stopped him from doing so, knowing the full extent of his mother's anger.

This all went on for a couple of hours more, until the trio came across a rather irate looking Spearow. "Ooh!" Delia drooled with a hungry gaze. "That looks like the perfect little treat!"

"M-mom, don't you think you've had enough?" Ash nervously asked, looking down at Delia's full stomach, even more, bloated than before. It squirmed and wiggled as the various Pokemon inside kicked and clawed, trying to escape.

"...Ash." Delia turned to her son, face turning serious. "Don't EVER try to limit how much food I can have." She gave her son a scolding kick to the face for good measure, making him fall to the ground with a heavy thud. Satisfied, she turned around and proceeded to devour the lone bird Pokemon.

The angry looking bird gave up a good fight, but it was no match to Delia's strength. But before it was doomed to her stomach, it let out a cry for help. "Spearow! Spearow!" It yelped as Delia slurped the last bit of it down her throat. Delia strode over to a downed log, before pausing and looking back at her son that rested on the ground, taking in the sight of Ash nursing a broken nose with an approving gaze. It served him right for trying to keep her from eating, and seeing him in pain that she caused warmed her soul and made her heart swell with love. She'll never let her son go, no matter how much he wanted to get away from her,

Ash rolled himself over onto his back; a seemingly simple process, yet he was giving soft grunts and growls with the effort of shifting his bulk, still sore from the squashing earlier in the day, breathing deeply by the time he’d managed to get himself propped up with his back against a tree's stump. Delia nodded and sat her fat ass down on the dead log, creaking under her weight as she rested her arms on the upper shelf of a rotund, exaggerated, and still squirming stomach. Even after she’d managed to get herself settled, the mother's figure remained in motion, the momentum traveling in sluggish ripples from the doughy rolls of her sides, up along her well-padded neck, and back down past her broad thighs and into the folded flab of her lazily-swaying buttocks. The spectacle of such gloriously-overfed women would certainly have been shocking to most trainers, thankfully there were none in sight save for Ash.

"Come on, Ash. Just because I'm resting doesn't mean that you get to. Now-...huh?" Delia looked up as she heard the telltale sound of Spearow crying, only more distorted and far away. She looked up in horror as a flock of those angry birds circled above her, swooping down for the kill. "...oh no."
111213.title: Delia Makes a Comeback

choices: A blue haired boy younger than him accompanied by a much larger blue haired girl
1112131.content:
The Spearow swooped and scratched the large woman, she tried to grab them but they proved to fast for her to grab. Delia was vulnerable to the fury of of the Pokemon as they scratched and pecked at her naked body. Ash noticed that the Spearow were ignoring him and Pikachu. Seeing this as an opportunity to escape his mother Ash ran off, still clutching his nose, Pikachu following close behind.

Unfortunately for Ash, despite being attack by a flock of Spearow she was still able to notice him trying to escape. "Ash! How dare you try and leave me! I'll find you, I'll always find you!" She screeched, but Ash was soon out of sight.

With renewed vigor she managed to grab and each and every Spearow and shoved them into her mouth, dooming them to being fa on her body. "You can run Ashy, but you can't hide." Delia said with a dark smile.

Still clutching his broken nose Ash made his way into the next town. "I need to find a way to help this heal." Ash muttered to himself, due to dealing with his nose he wasn't looking where he was going and ended up bumping into someone, but who is it?
1112131.title: Devour the Birds

11121311.content:
Ash had attempted to escape the abusive clutches of his mother by running away from her in the middle of the Spearow attack, but in his attention to his broken nose he sort of just walked around in a circle, only stopping until he bumped back into the person she was trying to get away from.

“Hello Ash.” Delia purred as she looked down at her son on the ground. “Did you have a nice walk?” Without any warning, she turned herself around, exposing her naked backside towards him, before leaning herself down into the earth with a heavy thud on top of him. Ash’s screams of pain were muffled under hundreds of pounds of fat as Delia sat her giant ass on his head and upper chest.

“Three minutes sounds like an appropriate punishment. Don’t you agree, Ashy?” Delia asked Ash knowing fully well that he couldn't hear her from underneath her blubbery buttocks. “I’s knew you would see it my way.”

Meanwhile, Pikachu watched with hesitation as he saw his new trainer get crushed underneath Delia. It was uncomfortable to watch, but he made no effort to help him. He only shocked Ash’s mother when she threatened to eat him, other than that he would have to fend for himself. Which he was failing miserably at.

After three minutes had gone by, Delia sighed contently and rose up from her seat atop Ash. Her son gasped for well needed air as she watched on in glee. “The next time you try and get away from me, It will be longer. Now get up!” She shouted authoritatively, snapping her fingers as she waited for Ash to stand back on his feet.

“I’m...I’m sorry mom…” Ash whimpered, his broken nose now evan worse.

“Oh for the love of Arceus…” Delia sighed and grabbed her son’s face violently. She took his nose and, with a loud pop, set the cartilage back into place. “There you overgrown baby, ya’ happy now?”

Delia, Ash, And Pikachu continue to make their way to Viridian City, But once they get they're...
11121311.title: His mother

choices: A Curvy but still skinny girl
111213113.content:
Ash, Delia and Pikachu had made it Viridian City, "Okay Ashy we need to get me some clothes before a cop throws a tantrum because I'm naked." Delia grumbles however Ash didn't respond. "Hey, did you hear me or is your nose still still distracting you?" Delia barked at Ash when she noticed he stopped walking

"S-s-sorry Mom, I could of sworn I heard someone crying." Ash said, he looked around and saw what the source was. Sitting on the edge of a fountain was a small seven year old boy with blue hair, a small mint green owl like Pokemon was trying to comfort him.

Ash decided to go up to the younger boy. "Hey, what's wrong?" Ash asked, not caring his mother was going to get mad at him. The crying boy looked up at him. "M-m-m-my big sister told me to wait here and that she would be back in a couple of minutes but it's been an hour and I'm really worried." The boy whimpered, the owl Pokemon nuzzling him.

Ash frowned "How about I stay with you until your sister get's back? What's your name?"

The bluenette started to calm down "M-morgan, I'd like that. Oh yeah, this is Rowlet." Morgan said holding up the shiny starter.

"Heck no! We need to go Ash!" Delia shouted Ash wincing. "Come on Mom, he's alone, it will be only for a little while." Ash argued, normally he would of submit to his mother but for whatever reason he was feeling braver than normal. "I don't care, I don't want to beat up cops because I'm naked." Delia grumbled.

"I have money" Morgan took a wallet out of his jacket, it was filled to the brim with cash.
Delia's eyes shined and took the wallet. Besides food her next favorite thing was free stuff so she had no qualms about taking money from a small child. "Okay sure, you can stay with him but if you're gone by the time I get back your punishment will be tripled." Delia threatened before leaving to the nearest clothing store.

It took only a couple of minutes but Delia returned wearing a pair of jeans and a white shirt.

"Is it okay if we have a battle while we wait for your sister?" Ash asked realizing he still hasn't had a battle with an actual person yet. "Sure, it will be my first battle in Kanto!" Morgan cheered getting up.

The battle began, oddly enough Pikachu decided to obey Ash, trying to blast electricity at the flying type. However it proved incredibly quick, being able to dodge the bolts and return fire with razor leaf.

Ash changed tactics by using quick attack which oddly enough seemed to work better but eventually the battle ended with a tie, both Pokemon knocking each other out when Pikachu used quick attack at the same time Rowlett used tackle.

"Wow Morgan, I'm impressed." Morgan turned around and his face lit up like it was Christmas "Lucina!" Morgan cheered when he saw his much older blue haired sister.

But how big is Lucina
111213113.title: Here Comes A New Challenger!

choices: Delia began to bloat with fat
1112131133.content:
Morgan’s bigger sister Lucina filled into the little grove outside Viridian City with ease due to her corpulent size. Ash, Pikachu, and even Delia looked up at the massive Bluenette, the boy and the Pokémon in awe at how big she was, and the mother in seeding jealousy at the thought of someone bigger than her. She was used to being the biggest girl in Pallet Town, but now she felt like a big fish coming out from a very small pond.

The massive bluenette giggled and grabbed her little brother by the sides with ease, giving Morgan a hug that threatened to envelop his whole body in her fatty breasts. He squirmed a little bit but reciprocated the hug as much as he could. “Thanks for looking after my lil’ bro you two.” Lucina addressed the mother-son duo. “An Officer Jenny gave me some trouble, and I was worried something bad might have happened to him while I was away.”

“It was no trouble ma’am!” Ash grinned and adjusted his cap, to which Delia scaled and slapped him on the side of the head.

“Yes, it was! We spend valuable time looking after some worthless shit so you could feel like you give a crap about him! Now come on, I’m starving!” Delia grabbed her son’s arm and began pulling him towards Viridian City when Lucina stepped in front of her path and stopped her trek cold. “What do you want, fatso?” She sneered impatiently.

Lucina gave Delia a bit of a scowl and set her younger brother Morgan down by her flabby hip. “You know, I used to be a lot like you; angry for almost no reason all the time, taking every chance to make my brother feel worthless, taking joy in seeing others in pain...that all changed when someone gave me these.” The bluenette fished an orange bottle of pills with no label on it. She unscrewed the cap off and fingered out a couple of tablets.

“So what, they made you a total pushover and slut?” Delia cackled, earning Lucina’s Ire. Suddenly and without warning, she let her anger take over and pushed a puffy hand into her laughing, open mouth, forcing the pills down her throat. On reflex, Delia swallowed them but wasn't happy about it at all. “You bitch, what did you just do?!”

“I fixed you.” Lucina smiled and picked Morgan back off from the ground. “When your feeling better, meet me up at the Pokemon Center.” She winked at Ash and walked off to Viridian City. Delia was about to chase after them, but after only two steps, she clutched at her chest and doubled over.

“M-mom, what’s wrong?” Ash asked as Delia began to pant heavily. She bit her lower lip hard as the pills began to change her. But how?

111213113331.content:
Ash decided that the best thing for him to do was to stay by his mother’s side and make sure he was around when she woke up. It took a little less than half on an hour, but soon Delia finally began to stir. She sat up and gave out an angelic sounding yawn as she raised her arms over her head. She opened her eyes and smiled without any malice towards her son.

“Good morning, Ash! Did you sleep well?” Delia questioned, seemingly to have forgotten this morning’s events. “I sure did! Mmm, I feel like I’ve been reborn!” Ash observed his mother with a cautious eye. Did those pills mess with her memory? She seemed like a whole new person. He was about to tell her what had happened with Lucina but chose against it. She could go back to how she was before, and he would be the one to blame.

Suddenly, Delia’s pot belly stomach gave out the loudest growl of hunger Ash had ever heard, to which she just playfully smacked it. “Mm… I’m hungry…” she mused, still kneading and rubbing her tummy. “I don’t know why, but I feel like I could eat a Wailord!”

“Uhh...h-hey mom? Why don’t we head into the city and get some food at the Pokémon Center?” Ash offered, suddenly regretting he said so since her newly bought clothes were now nothing but shreds. But by then it was too late, and Delia nodded in approval.

“Great Idea, Ash! I didn’t know we were so close to the next city, but I won’t look a gift horse in the mouth.” Delia stood up, now twice her son’s height. Suddenly, Ash felt her hands around his waist, and he was lifted up into the air against her bulging bosom, with Pikachu clinging onto his pants. “C’mon, a gal this big needs food to grow!”

“So mom, uh…” Ash fumbled his words as Delia walked past a snoozing Officer Jenny at the border of the City. “Are you alright? You seem a bit...different today.”

“What are you talking about, sweetie?” Delia tilted her head down. “I guess you could say I’m a bit more hungry than usual but other than that I’m fine. After living a month in the beaten path, I’m ready for some good old fashioned city food!”

“...month!?” Ash exclaimed, surprised at how loud he said it. “I mean...has it really been that long? It feels like I only started this morning…”

“”Really? Because to me, it feels like it’s been longer!” Delia hugged Ash even harden into her bosom. She seemed to have changed into someone more loving and doting, but she was still no less dominating and overprotective. “I was just a skinny lil’ twig back in Pallet Town, but you asking me to come on your Journey had to be your best decision ever! Just look at how big I’ve gotten!” She wobbled her assets happily, making Ash blush against his will.

“Now, where is that...oh, there's the Pokemon Center!” Delia pointed out to a red-roofed building on the other side of the street. After a brief trek, Delia set her son and Pikachu down and entered the main atrium of the building, instantly making her way towards the cafeteria for trainers. “Pick up the pace, young man! There won’t be enough food left for you if you don’t!”

“What did those pills do to her? Ash mused as he followed after his mother, having to run a little bit to keep up with her fast gait. Inside the cafeteria, he instantly made out the massive bluenette and her younger brother, Lucina, and Morgan. “Hey, you two!” Ash made his way to the brother-sister duo as Delia lined up in the buffet line.

“Hey there!” Lucina waved as Ash rushed over. “So, how do you like your new mom?”

“What did you do to her? She’s all...nice and loving and weird now!” Ash wasn't protesting the change, he was actually very happy for it to have happened! But he needed answers, t was all just too much for him right now. “How did you do that, what are in those pills?!”

Lucina just giggled at Ash’s constant barrage of questions and fished out the pills from her bosom. “I won’t reveal my sources, but these little miracles turned me from a cruel sadist to the flower child you see before you. It works a little different on whoever uses it, but it looks like your mom's transformation was right what I was going for."

"Is...Is she going to be okay?" Ash questioned. "I know she's not the nicest person, but she's still my mom."

"Oh sure, she'll be...uh...wow, that's a lot of food." Lucina gapped as she saw Delia with a tray underneath a veritable mountain of food making her way towards her son. "I think those pills must have messed with her hunger. Well...don't worry, she's totally harmless now, probably anyways.” She chuckled, but her heart wasn’t into it.

“Ash, I see you’ve made some new friends!” Delia exclaimed with a hungry grin as she sat her mountain of foodstuffs on the table. “Hello there! My name s Delia, and this here is my Son, Ash!”

“It’s certainly a pleasure to meet you, Delia!” Lucina grinned back.

Morgan continued to converse with Ash, but he was only half listening. He was a good kid, and he was interested in what he had to say, but he found himself...entranced by his 'new' mother. When she had first gotten into the Pokemon Center Cafeteria, she was a foot taller than her new friend Lucina, but noticeably thinner, with all of her weight seeming to have transformed into height when she took those pills. But while he had no idea how the miracle medication actually worked, he began to notice that it had a clear effect on his mom's metabolism.

Delia was still stark nude from when she tore through her clothes earlier, so Ash had a clear view of her mother's body slowly but surely bloat outwards with plush flab. She was only halfway through her veritable mountain of food she had made for herself, but he looked like she was also halfway back to her original body shape; large, blubbery, and jiggling all over. She caught her son looking at her, and gave him a girlish giggle and a cute wink, cupping one of her boobs cheerfully. Normally this would have disgusted Ash, but he felt like his relationship with his mother was changing.

At first, she was a cruel and wicked mistress that delighted in seeing him suffer, but now he felt like she was an actual mother; loving, caring and understanding. How would it change next? Had everything about who she was before lost? Only two minutes later, Delia had finished her feast, and she was back to her old, fatty self, perhaps even bigger! Her gut pushed up onto the table and folded in two, and Ash couldn't help himself from wanting to rub it. "Mmmmm...that was good..." Delia purred as she rubbed her stuffed gut. "Not as good as Pokemon, but still good enough, I suppose."

This statement took everyone at the table by surprise. "O-oh..." Lucina paused with caution. "You eat Pokemon, still?"

"Well, of course, I do young lady?" Delia tilted her head to the side a little, curious why she would be confused by this. "A women can't get this big by just eating normal food, can she? Ask Ash, he's the one who fed them to me!" Lucina looked as Ash, who was just as shocked as her and quietly mouthed 'no' to her.

"He's such a good boy, always willing to devote his entire life to me~" Delia swooned as she suddenly grabbed Ash by the shoulder and scooched him to her seat. "He practically begged me to come on his Pokemon Journey with him, and helped me develop a taste for red meat too! He's my pride and joy!" Delia planted a kiss on Ash's forehead, inadvertently smooshing his face to her naked breast flesh.

1112131133311443.content:
As Lucina watched on at his younger brother Morgan be forcefully snuggled and teased by the much older women, something within her began to stir back to life. The person who she was before she had taken the mysterious medication, had awoken to the sight of her sibling being dominated by Delia. A flood of memories began to surface back to her mind, memories of the bluenette bullying him, teasing him, squashing him within an inch of his life for the tiniest infractions…

What happy memories they were! Lucina began to sigh wistfully as she remembered her old self. A smile crept to her face as Morgan struggled to breathe under the monumental torrent of Delia’s boob flesh. These thoughts were interrupted, however, by a sudden pang of hunger and a deep growl from her gut. Blushing, she rubbed it gently. She had already finished her normal helping of food, so was she still hungry?

“Lu-Lucina?” Morgan pleaded quietly as Delia continued her assault of dominating affection. “Could I get a li-little help over here?” Lucina looked into her younger brother’s eyes and gave him a big wide smile. But it wasn't the smile he was used to, the one that carried all of that sisterly affection. It was predatory and passionate, and Morgan immediately began to feel a sense of dread.

“Hey, Delia?” Lucina rose from her seat at the booth and, to Ash and Morgan’s surprise, but no one else in the cafeteria since the practice was common, began to strip down her pants. “Could you put Morgan back down on my seat? I wanna show him how much I love ‘em.” Delia was confused by the request for a moment, but then understood exactly what she meant. She nodded approvingly and pushed Morgan back to his side of the table with her sister.

“Lucina, what are you-” Morgan’s sentence was cut off as Lucina sat back down to her seat directly on top of him, directing his head into her passage forcefully. Ash looked on in horror, while Delia just smiled. She had completely changed from how she was a few moments ago! He wanted to look away, but it the sight was akin to a car crash; there was something about the devastation that was so entrancing that it needs your full attention. The bluenette moaned as she felt her younger brother struggle against his sudden confines, making her whole body jiggle and quiver.

The scene was over just as fast as it had come, and Lucina was sitting where Morgan once was, panting as she rubbed her now bulging, bouncing stomach. Ash wanted to say something, he really did, but his mouth was too dry to force the words out. Pikachu was just as stupefied and cautiously hid underneath the table for good measure. “Sorry if you wanted to have him, Delia.” She shook her new belly, testing the feel. “Just seeing him all defenseless like that...it really worked up an appetite.”

“It’s no trouble, my dear, I know all too well!” Delia giggled and, once again, forcefully pulled in ash for another crushing hug. “The only reason I keep Ash around is that he catches me food!”

“Say...what do you say to have a traveling buddy?” Lucina piped up, noting how similar Ash looks to her brother. “I could use another boy toy since mine is a bit occupied at the moment, and even though just met… really like you, and I think it would be great if we could travel together!”

Delia, for a moment, was stunned by the offer, and then rose from her seat to pull the younger girl into a hug. “Oh, of course, Lucina! We’ll have loads of fun, and Ash will be right there to help us get even bigger!”

Ash felt like his life has spun out of control. This morning had such a clear purpose, and now he felt like his life had only gotten worse. Not only was he stuck with his mom, even if she is a 'bit' nicer, but he also had to deal with this Lucina. How would he get through this? And why...why did he feel excited about it at the same time? He did not understand it, but the thought of these two women getting even bigger and fatter was intriguing, and as much as he was disgusted by the means for that to happen, he still found himself wanting it.

“Lucina…” Ash spoke up hesitantly. “Is Morgan...going to be okay?”

“Of course! I would never digest my lil’ bro...I mean, I would eat him, but never digest!”

What will happen now?

“May, for the love of Arceus, PLEASE go home! It’s five O'clock in the morning!” Professor Birch cried out exasperated, having forced out of bed by May knockin on her door violently at such un-legendary hour. He was standing in front of the doorway to his house slash laboratory with the chubby girl in question holding her arms in front of her buxom chest and her little brother Max, still in his pajamas, rubbing the sleep out of his eyes.

“Too fucking bad ya’ old windbag!” May forced herself into Professor Birch’s building, pushing him out of the way while dragging Max behind her who struggled to keep up. For such an overweight girl she sure move fast! “I Came here nice and early so I can get first dibs on those Pokemon! I don’t wanna get stuck with the crappy, derpy one that no one chose.”

“You’re a hundred percent sure that Mom is okay with all of this?” Max questioned her big sister, excited that he was going on a Pokemon Journey early, but kind of freaked out at how fast everything was going for him. “I mean, I love you ‘cause your my sister, but...do you know anything about being a Pokemon Trainer?”

“Phhht! Of course not ya’ idiot! That’s why I’m bringing you along!” May teased as she ruffled Max’s hair. “You’ll be the brains, and I’ll be the muscle, it’s the perfect fit! So quit whining about it and help me choose my Pokemon!”

“O-our P-p-pokemon, you mean?”

“Nope! My Pokemon!”


“Now wait just a minute you!” Professor Birch put himself between the Pokeball Containment machine and May. “I’m happy that you're finally going to go on your journey after being eight years late, but this isn’t how things are done! You need to fill out your official Pokemon Trainer’s license paperwork, you need to pass the exams you never took to qualify! I can’t in good conscious-”

The Pokemon Professor was not allowed to finish that sentence as May punched him hard in the forehead, knocking him out cold. He stumbled and fell to the ground, inadvertently opening the containment device in the process.

“May!” Max gasped at the sight of such violence. “You didn’t need to hurt him!”

“Oh relax you fuckin’ pussy, he’ll be fine!” May rolled her eyes in mock annoyance. She turned her attention to the three Pokeballs in front of her. Treecko, Torchic, and Mudkip. May, however i, really did not know a single bit of information about Pokemon other than that they test amazing. So, she was going to have to rely on her little brother for help. “Hey, which one of this morsels-I mean lil’ guys is the best?”

“Well...I’d pick Torchic. It may have a lot of weaknesses, but it makes up for it in it’s strengths. If we look at the Gym leader’s we’ll be facing on our journey…”

“BORING!” May interrupted Max’s spiel before he got too into his own explanation She loved him, but sometimes he was just too nerdy to be around with. “Torchic it is, huh? Well, you’re the expert I guess.”

May shrugged, picked up Torchic’s Pokeballs, and lazily tossed the special device into the air. The ball erupted into a stream of light which reveals the chick Pokemon to the world. It looked up at May, it’s new master, and was slightly intimidated by her large stature.

‘Alright, introductions. I’m May, that’s Max, and you are now my property. Got it?” May put her hands on her hips as her shadow loomed over the small Pokemon. “Step outta line, and you dela with me. Your job in life is to fight in battles and win me prize money. Understand?”

The Torchic shivered in fear and nodded up and down, eager to not get abused by this callous eighteen year old. Satisfied, May opened the Pokeball again, this time spewing a red light that put the Pokemon back inside. She pocketed the ball in her purse and turned around to face Max with a determined smile.

“All right, let’s get out of this boring town and start our journey!”

Begrudgingly, May took out her only potion and shoved it into Max’s arms. “Here, I don’t know how to use it. And I don’t want to.”

My names Jeff.” The shiny ralts said in its Pokemon language before being put on fire. “This is Fine.” The other ralts getting scratched by Torchic. “Here we go!” May through a pokeball at the shiny Ralts and after it shook a little bit it dinged signifying May caught it. “Now what am I going to do with you?” May asked staring at the terrified non shiny ralts. “Well even if it’s a regular ralts May it’s still very rare to find one and besides there are two different options ralts so it works out if you do catch it.” Max informed, May secretly glad for the information.

What does May with the other ralts
1121322.title: A rare Pokemon comes out of the blue!

11213222.content:
Although it would technically HER Pokemon, since she’s the trainer and Max is just along for the ride, May decided that her little brother should have a Pokemon too. She brought out her last Pokeball, as everything else in her purse was just a bunch of snacks, and threw it to the injured psych Pokemon. The Ralts was soon ceased in the shiny sphere. It shook for a few seconds, before it made a cheerful ding, signalling that it had been caught.

After picking up the ball off the ground, she proceeded to hand it over to Max. “Here ya’ go Munchkin! It’s not as good as mine, that’s for sure, but...I wouldn't have gotten it without you.”

Max was silent for a moment, a little shocked that May would do something so nice for him. Eventually the younger brother smiled and graciously took the Pokeball. “Just don’t tell anyone you ain’t ten yet. We don’t need the cops on our ass all the time.” May added sternly.

Suddenly, May’s chubby stomach gave out a loud gurgle, which made its owner wince a little in pain. “Geez, battling Pokemon works up an appetite, huh? Alright Max, gimme my food.”

“A-a-are you sure? We just ate an hour ago, and the next town is only ten minutes away…” Max reasoned.

“That’s the point stupid! It’s been an hour since I last ate. A whole figging’ hour! I’m surprised I ain't’ hungrier! I can’t wait ten minutes to eat at the Pokemon Center, I’ll starve!” May counterred his brother’s logic impatiently. “Now hurry up, your big sister needs you!”

Max sighed and slugged off one of the food packs. May eagerly tore into the satchel and began to devour as much as she could. Max always kinda liked watching his sister eat. He liked seeing her big gut steadily get bigger with food, and how the next day she would look a little fatter all over. May noticed her brother’s states, and teasingly smacked her belly making it jiggle like jello. Max blushed and looked away.

Soon, May had demolished at least half of the food in the bag. She handed it back to Max for him to carry. It was still heavy, but he appreciated the weight lifted off his shoulders a little. “That was a nice snack. A little light, but I think I’ll manage until the Pokemon Center.” May patted her gut, filled with food to turn into more fat.

Soon. Max and May had finally exited Route 101 and made it to Oldale Town. The small hamlet was beautiful, the flowering bunches of flowers contrasting nicely with the lush groves of trees. While Max was entranced by the villages beauty, May was looking at the place more practically. The town was a step up from Littleroot, but that was because that it had a Pokecenter and PokeMart. Other than that, they're was little to nothing of interest in Oldale.

“C’mon Max, stop lollygagging! We’re going to the PokeCenter to heal up my Pokemon and get some more food.” May grabbed her sitarcted brother’s arm and took tugged it in the direction of the red building. Max was disappointed, but he realized he was being selfish when May reminded him that his Ralts was hurt.

Walking into the Pokemon Center, the duo was greeted by a cheerful Nurse Joy. “Welcome to the PokeCenter! How can I help-?”

May interrupted her by slamming her two Pokeballs on the counter, while Max carefully set his own Pokeball down as well. “Yeah, yeah, let’s make this quick. My Pokemon need healing and I’m hungry. Where’s the cafeteria?”

“Oh!” Nurse Joy was taken aback by the abruptness of May’s behaviour, but still put up a polite smile. “Well, if you need a pick me up from your long journey, we offer free food in the Enrichment Center down below! If you’ll just follow the-”.

“Hold up, did you say that the food was free!?” May widened her eyes in shock, believing she was going to be limited by how much money she had.

“Why yes! Al services for Pokemon Trainers are free of charge!” Nurse Joy added with a smile.

May was silent for a moment before erupting into a fit of giggles. Before Nurse Joy could ask if hse was alright, she made a Beeline to the stairwell that lead to the Enrichment Center down below. Max shook his head and sighed. “You shouldn't have told her that. My sister has the stomach of a black hole.”

“O-oh…” Nurse Joy’s smile faltered for a moment. The next shipment of food from Petalburg won’t be for another week, and she needed to make due with what she had. ‘Well, I-i'm sure she’ll stop sometime.”

Half an hour later…

“GET OUT!” Nurse Jouy angrilly pushed May out of the Pokemon Center. “And take your Pokemon with you!” She threw her Pokeballs at the stuffed girl’s face. The sliding door of the Pokemon Center closed and beeped as a red light signalled that it was locked.

“Did you really have to eat everything that they had?” Max asked his big sister with a deadpan tone. May’s stomach was now sated, after stuffing it with enough food to feed a normal family of five. It bulged out heavily from her now ruined red vest, the sphere of flesh spilling over her waist heavily.

“What? I was hungry!” May defended herself. “Anyways, we're done here. C’mon, let's head out!”
11213222.title: Catch it and give it to Max

112132221.content:
Before May could leave the town Max stopped her, or at least tried to. “May, we need more supplies.” Max said tugging on the back of his older sister’s shirt. “Oh yeah, we should definitely get more food, good thinking.” May said with a smile, Max sighing in response. “We have to get pokemon related supplies, we have plenty of food.” Max said sternly, all that did was make May laugh. “You’re so cute when you’re trying to be serious but okay we’ll get some pokemon stuff if that’ll make you happy.” May said giggling pinching Max’s cheek.

At the Pokemart May bought 9 pokeballs, about twenty or so potions, a couple of heals, and enough pokemon food to feed the pokemon for two weeks. Despite the fact that May was rather disrespectful and...well….fat she was a surprisingly hard worker when it came to her chores and took hygiene rather seriously so she had a lot of money from her allowance. Max also grabbed a free guide and map of Hoenn.

As they made their way Max decided to let his Ralts out of its pokeball. “May already has a Ralts and it would be confusing if both of you went by Ralts. Maybe I can give you a nickname?” Max said to himself quietly as his sister trudged ahead. A couple of minutes later Max thought of a name “I’ll call you Forrest.” Max whispered, he then heard rustling noise behind him. Max turned around and slowly walked toward the source of the noise. He fell on his rear when something jumped out of the grass. A small blue pokemon with a green lily pad on his head and six stubby legs. “Lotad” The pokemon said cheerfully, Max smiling a bit and laughing. “Hey there little guy, I’m Max.” The young boy greeted with a gentle smile.

May was walking ahead, defeating anybody dumb enough to go against her and getting money from them. “Hey Max, I’m getting hung-” May turned around and saw her brother was gone, “Crap, I knew something was wrong when I didn’t hear him. I swear if anybody hurts him they are in for a world of pain.” May said before dashing off in the opposite direction.

May was panting somewhat taking a break from finding Max, she perked up when she heard his giggling and dashed off to the direction of it. She was shocked to find Max and his Ralts playing with some random pokemon. “Max what are you doing!?” May yelled putting her hands on her wide hips. “S-s-sorry May, I got distracted.” Max apologized to the large girl. May pinched the bridge of her nose. “It’s okay, I should of done a better job at keeping track of you. However that pokemon right there better be rare.” May said pointing at the Lotad. “Well, it’s a Lotad, it’s not necessarily rare but it’s a lot less common than a Zigzagoon or Poochyena. Please can I have it? Besides it’ll be very useful for the first gym.” Max begged with puppy dog eyes. May sighed “Okay, okay but the next pokemon that ends up distracting you better be super rare or I’ll get ticked off.” May said before digging through her bag and tossing the Pokeball at the Lotad. “There ya go Munchkin.” May said waiting for Max to pick up the ball before picking him up and running as fast as she could to make up for lost time. ‘I think I’ll call you Dish.” Max thought to himself with a smile.
112132221.title: Max reminds May to Restock

1121322211.content:
Petalburg City was a small little place in Southwestern Hoenn. The whole town’s air was heavily laden with salt with the ocean being so close by. The name of it all was incredibly misleading: there were no petals in that burg because the maritime climate forbade it, and it could hardly be big enough to be called a city.

Yet, Max and May did not dwell on these factual thoughts for long, For there was something even more pressing at hand for their attention to be on. Petalburg City was the home to their first Pokémon Gym, operated by the normal type specialist Norman Norman.

Max and May’s Dad.

The Norman family emigrated to Hoenn a decade ago, before Max was born and when May was only eight years old. Norman had been offered a Job as Gym Leader, and he couldn’t refuse, no matter how much his wife protested. The move put so much strain on their marriage that they divorced.

May has a mixed relationship with her father. She had picked up all of his bad habits, swearing, slovenly behavior, laziness. And she does love him and always liked it when she got to visit him. But she also resents him for putting their happy lives on the line just for some stupid job. For Max, it’s even worse. Norman is like this kind of nice, kind of rude stranger in his life.

Frankly, he would have preferred to just skip the whole ordeal of challenging him and just move on to the Pokemon Center, But May was already dragging him to the place. The two did not have to look very hard to find the man, as he was kicking out a defeated trainer out from his gym. “Damn brat, wasting my time…” he muttered to himself. He took out a metal flask from the lining of his coat and took a swig of it, yellowish fluid trickling down his lips.

“Still day drinking whiskey, Huh dad?” Norman almost did a spit tank when he heard the incredibly familiar voice of his obese daughter. He turned around, still chugging the alcohol, to find May and Max staring at him. “You know, I tried drinking once. Tasted boring, plus, I think I’m too fat to get drunk.”

“May! Max!” Norman tied the cap back onto his flask and quickly put it back into his coat pocket. He ran up and gave his daughter a hug, his form sinking into her flabby frame. “What with the Surprise visit? I don’t have custody in a month.”

“W-were In our Pokemon J-journey…” Max stuttered, shifting behind her big sister as to distance himself from the normal type gym leader.

“Pokémon Journey? That can’t be right, you have to be ten to go out into the world, and you little man, are-...Wait…” Norman broke off the hug With May. “Did I miss his tenth birthday?!”

May, not wanting to get caught with forcing his seven year old brother into a Pokémon Journey, quickly went along. “Uhh, yep! It was last month! We tried calling you, but-“

“I was probably too hung over…” Norman lamented, drooping his head in shame. “Arceus damnit, I’m a worse father than I thought I was. Since your here, you might as well come in for a spell. Maybe I can whip up a present or two for the tyke.”

Norman headed back inside the gym, expecting his two children to follow. May felt a little bad to see Norman down in the dumps like that, but it was all for a good cause! Norman may not be the best dad of the year, but he was still a good one in her books. It was sad to see him so easy to accept that he missed out on three years of his son;s life due to his drinking habits “Come on Max, let’s head inside. And if dad asks what you want for a present, make sure it’s food.”
1121322211.title: Head to Petalburg City

11213222111.content:
Max and May head inside the gym after their father. “Dad, is it okay if I can have a battle with you?” May asked Norman. “How many badges do you have?” Norman asked turning around to stare into his daughters eyes which appeared to be that of a sober persons. “W-w-what?” May stuttered surprised by Norman’s seriousness. “I said, how many badges do you have?” Norman asked, more sternly.

“N-n-none” May stuttered feeling embarrassed for once. “Well, you can’t have a battle with me. While it is somewhat of a dumb rule the only battles I am allowed to have are gym battles unless if I’m going against another gym leader or if under special circumstances, as much I’d love for you to go against your old man, if I have a battle with you right now I would get fired, and I really do need this job May. You’ll have to get four badges before you can challenge me. Now hold tight while I go grab something.” Norman said before ruffling Max’s hair before leaving the kids alone in their room. “C-c-can I have Big May?” Max asked timidly, he always felt uncomfortable around his father at times not knowing what to do when he’s with him alone, which was thankfully very rarely as May was normally with him on those visits. “Sure thing Munchkin” May said softly before giving the seven years old a hug wrapping him on her warm, soft body.

Max and May stopped the hug just on time when Norman walked back in the room holding two Pokèballs. “While I may have forgotten your birthday Max I do have two very good gifts for you. As you may or may not know one of the gym leaders duties is going to other regions to check up on other regions and in these pokeballs are two normal type Pokemon that you can’t get in Hoenn.” Norman said with a proud grin on his face.

What are the two Pokemon Norman gives to Max?
11213222111.title: You don’t always get what you want

choices: ...until a sickly, green haired boy showed up.
...until two funny dressed goons showed up.
...and it stayed that way until morning.
112132221112.content:
Max took the two Pokeballs from his estranged father and apprehensively opened them to reveal the strange Pokemon inside. The liquid light spewed from where the metallic spheres opened, and two small Pokemon emerged from it’s materialization.

The first one was a baby deer looking Pokemon with a pink upper body and a cream lower body. A yellow tuft of hair in the shape of a blossoming flower was placed on it’s head. It looked up to Max and smiled, but cowered a little when it caught glance at May. The older sister rolled her eyes and huffered her puffy arms over her heaving bosom. She wasn’t even trying to be intimidating yet! Maybe she needs to work on her people skills...or she’s hungry. Yep, probably just hungry.

The second Pokemon was a small, lizard like thing with a tapered tail, short arms and legs, and a pale yellow body with black frills. This Pokemon had a different reaction to it’s new masters than the previous one. It looked up to Max, gave a polite smile and nodded it’s head, almost like it had sized him up and gave the boy approval to take charge of It. But when it saw May, instead of turning away in fear, a low tinge of pink crept up to it’s face as it eyed the human’s thick, juicy curves. ‘The poor creature must have a thing for bigger girls’, Max thought as a bit of drool exited from its mouth.

“These two guys are called Deerling and Helioptile. They don’t look like much, but with a lil’ elbow grease and Rare Candies, you two will be the envy of Hoenn!” Norman excalimned.

The two Pokemon were soon called back into their respective Pokeballs, to the Deerling’s relief and the Helioptile’s annoyance. Max pocketed them in with one of the food bags, making a mental note to take them out before his big sister gets hungry again. May has been good about not eating any Pokemon so far, but he’d be lying if he said he trusted her completely. The two Pokemon could easily get lost in one of her binges, much less their own Pokeballs

Norman decided that May and Max should spend the night over in his gym, but May was eager to get back on the road. In another moment of soberness, the Gym Leader gave a sly smile and asked how his daughter liked sleeping on the ground in the cold outside. May realized in her eagerness to get her Pokemon Journey started and focus on food, she forgot to pack sleeping bags and tents. She reluctantly relented and agreed to stay the night.

Max got to spend some time getting to know his new Pokemon, while May helped herself to the Gym’s breakroom fridge. Norman, knowing how much of a glutton his daughter could be, didn't even try to stop her, and almost encouraged her by telling her that she missed a spot somewhere. It was a slow day at the Gym, so it was basically empty for the rest of the day...
112132221112.title: Helioptile and Deerling

choices: May helps Wally catch a Pokémon first
May treats herself to the local wildlife first
The Route entrance is being blocked by a couple of goons
1121322211121.content:
However, the silence of the day was interrupted by the sound of the Gym Doors swinging open just before dinner was served, much to May’s irritation. The place was just about to close, and someone just had to come now of all times? It was a green haired, sickly looking boy who was fidgeting his thumbs together as he nervously made his way into her father’s Gym.

“Hey brat, whaddya want?” May inquired curtly, not one for polite small talk. Or politeness.

The brat in question was started by the shrill nature of May’s voice, and her dominating and huge figure was doing nothing to help his nerves. “I-i-i-is Mr. Norman here?” The fragile looking child stuttered.

“Yeah, but you’re not talking to him, your talking to me.” May walked forward towards the boy, her fat gut jiggling hypnotically as she did so, only stopping until she was inches away from the sick brat’s form, “So quit stammering and get on with it already! Wasting my time enough as it is…”

The young child with green hair went bug eyed as he had to look past May’s cleavage to look at her face. Perhaps coming here was not the best idea after all. “I-I...I’m sorry.” The boy lamented. “I just...I was hoping Mr. Norman could help me catch a Pokemon…”

To this, May started to guffaw mercilessly. “Seriously?! You want to be a Pokemon Trainer?!”

“Well...y-yeah!” The green haired kid defended himslef, his chest inflating a little bit with pride, only to be later deflated by a fit of coughing. “What *HACK* is so funny *HicCUP* about that?”.

“Just look at yourself!” May bumped her fat, heavy stomach into the boy’s torso, making him fall to the floor like a glass figurine from a shelf. “You can barely stand a little nudge, let alone own a Pokemon! You’re better off going back home and whacking off in your bedroom, punk.”

“N-no!” The boy felt s pang it anver go through him, giving him the energy to stand up again. “I- I’m tired of people telling me I’m too weak to be a Pokémon Tra-Trainer! I’m f-fine, see?”

May was about to fail this kid about how he was obviously lying about being ‘fine’, when she was approached by a sudden flashback to when she was younger. When Max was just born, people always called her a fat freak, and was too obese and lazy to go on a journey. It made her bitter and resentful towards pretty much everyone save for her family. And look at her now, on a Pokémon Journey! She would have loved to see the look on their faces now!

May felt, for a rare time in her life, a little sympathy for the sniveling boy in front of her. If she can do it, he can do it to, right? Although, she still wasn't convinced on going to help him catch a Pokémon. Dinner was just around the corner and…

Wait a minute.

Dinner.

It May helps this kid get a Pokémon, it would be an excuse to get away from Max. Now, May loved her little brother to death, but he was so adamant on the whole ‘No eating Pokémon’ thing, that they're were times she needed some alone time. And this was the perfect cover! She would help this kid catch a Pokémon, while she would be doing some ‘catching’ of her own!

“Alright kid.” May wiped some of the drool from her lower lip while fantasizing the feast she was gonna get. “You wanna be a Pokemon Trainer? Prove it. C’mon, I’m gonna help you catch a Pokémon.”

May walked past the sickly kid, purposely bumping into him on the way for a tease. He staggered, but held his ground, determined to get stronger in spite of his illness. He followed May out of the Gym and onto the next Route.

“Hey brat, what’s your name anyways?”

“I-it’s Wally. Wally Sapphires
1121322211121.title: ...until a sickly, green haired boy showed up.

choices: May offers to bring Wally with her
May decides to just keep Max
11213222111212.content:
“Sure,I’ll help you catch a Pokemon but on one condition.” May said to the scrawny child who appeared to be ten and was somewhat taller than Max. “O-o-o-Okay What is that?” Wally stuttered hoping it wasn’t that much. “You aren’t allowed to tell anyone about anything that I do while you’re getting your Pokemon, you can tell people I helped you catch a Pokemon but nothing more. Now stay right there while I go tell my dad that I’m leaving.” May said before running to where her dad was. “Hey dad, I’m going to go help this kid catch a Pokemon you and Max can have dinner without me.” May said quickly before rushing off.

“Okay Wally borrow Torchic here and go find a Pokemon, I’m going to go get something to eat.” May said licking her lips before going off in the opposite direction.

May picked up a zigzagoon and stuffed it in her mouth and swallowed it. After that she heard several more zigzagoons crying out and running in the opposite direction but to no avail as May quickly caught up to the normal type Pokemon and shoved multiple down her through and enjoyed feeling the squirming Pokemon in her glorious gut. May continued on her feast and she wasn’t even paying attention to the fact she was about to shove a ralts in her mouth. “Hey what the heck!” May saw she was no longer holding anything and she looked down and saw a couple feet away Wally was holding a pokeball. “You have major balls to catch the Pokemon that I was about to eat.” May said and Wally tensed up before May started laughing. “Good job kid, there’s not that many people that would do something like that!”

May stopped laughing and started thinking, Wally was a pretty cute kid, obviously not as cute as Max, but a close second. As well she could use him to carry food and that would help get him into shape. Also he could keep Max busy so she could eat more Pokemon. However Wally could end up creating a third wheel in the group which may cause problems. Wally could end up preventing May from getting extra intimate with Max. May thought of some more pros and cons before coming to a conclusion.
11213222111212.title: Gluttony is Overrun

choices: Wally is there waiting in the morning
Wally is a no-show. Time to make a house call
Max wakes up in the middle of the night
112132221112121.content:
May looked over the sickly looking child called Wally Sapphires. He really was a bit of a cutie. Even though he was ten, and taller than her brother Max, he was kinda of small for his age, which made it easy for her to order him around and get what she wanted from him. He was skinny and frail with messy, green hair and blueish grey eyes. After a few moments of thinking, May had come to a decision:

This kid was just too good looking to pass up. Sure, it might create a third wheel situation later on, but she could use the extra hands to carry her food on her journey. Plus, Getting to know the brat better may not be so bad. She got up from the trampled grass she was sitting on and walked up to Wally, nervously clutching his newly caught Ralts in his hands as her shadow began to loom over his diminutive form.

“Listen up, pipsqueak. Today is your lucky day! Pack your stuff, because tomorrow morning, you are gonna come with me on my Pokemon Journey!” May beamed with a toothy smile.

“O-ooh…” Wally replied with a slow stutter, trying to shift the gaze of his eyes, yet always coming back to May’s huge gut still squirming with Pokemon inside. “Thank you for helping me catch a Pokemon and the offer, b-but...I only move here yesterday, and my parents…”

“Hey, that’s okay lil’ guy.” May replied sweetly, ruffling his green hair with a bloated hand. “I get it. New town, sights to see and all that. Don’t want to leave your mom and dad, especially on a day’s notice…”

“Y-yeah! That’s it!” Wally’s mood was brought up by May understanding the situation.

“Although I am gonna have to eat you now.” May continued casually.

It took a moment for Wally to comprehend what May just said. After a few seconds of pregnant silence, he finally spoke up. “...I’m sorry, what?”

“You heard me.” May suddenly picked the poor boy up by his sides and lifted him up off of the ground. “Listen kid, one thing you gotta know about me, I hate it when things don’t go my way. I want you to come on my Pokemon Journey. Why? ‘Cause you're almost as fucking cute as my brother Max, and that is saying something. But since you’re not, well…”

May ominously brought Wally closer to her massive chest, his frail body almost grazing the fabric of her bra. “...your only good to me as food.”

“Wait!” Wally shouted, terrified beyond what he thought possible. He had just witnessed May eat dozens of Pokemon be doomed to her eternal pit called a stomach. He didn't want to end up in they're like the rest of them. “I-I-I-I changed my mind! I’ll come on your Journey! I’ll do everything you say, just don’t-!”

“Great!” May released Wally from her vice grip and let him fall back to the Earth with a thud. “I’m glad you saw reason. Now, run along home and pack your stuff, and be ready at seven o'clock in the morning at my dad’s gym. Or else!”

“Y-yes ma’am!” Wally nodded vigorously, and began to ran as fast as he could without aggravating his lungs towards his parents new house.

May watched Wally run away, and when she thought he was out of sight, she began to chuckle to herself. What was a chuckle than turned into a fit of deep throated cackles as she couldn't believe she got away with what happened. May never really meant to eat kid. No, he was far too cute to get rid of. But he bought the act so quickly. It was hilarious to the eighteen year old, and it took her a good five minutes of this laughing to finally calm down.

“Wally Sapphires,” May wiped a tear from her eye from laughing too hard. “I think the two of us are gonna have a beautiful relationship.”

After that, May walked back to her dad’s gym. She had missed dinner, but that wasn't a major loss of her, at least tonight. The squirms in her belly had finally died down, and it was starting to process the creatures inside into more fat on her lovely frame. But Pokemon are a lot harder to digest than regular food, and she soon found herself drained of energy. “Time for bed I guess…”

Entering the room Norman had set up for May and Max to sleep in, May found that her younger brother was already sleeping away in the mattress on the floor. Grinning slyly, May quietly got into the bed with him, her massive body taking up most, if not all, of the surface area. Max, still sleeping, rolled over to to where May was due to her weight. Gently, she lowered herself down onto his body, effectively smothering him in her own flab. With a sufficient pillow underneath her, May dozed off into sleep with him...

What happens next
112132221112121.title: May offers to bring Wally with her

choices: The Trio make it to Rustboro city
May is challenged by a boy with a pikachu (Ash) and loses
1121322211121211.content:
May awoke and was pleased to see she had gotten bigger, the strange thing was she mostly increased in height now being 6’6 but her chest was now larger as well, however other than that there wasn’t that much of a total increase May,asking a mental note to either eat more Pokemon next time or eat bigger Pokemon. May remembered that Max was underneath her and lifted herself up from him. May cooed as Max was still sleeping, May almost didn’t want to wake him up, almost. May lifted up the still sleeping max and licked his face (and noting he was delicious).

“Don’t eat me! Oh hi May.” Max sighed after panicking a bit, May giggling. “Silly Max, I couldn’t eat you even if I wanted too, however I am getting close to being capable of doing so.” May said as she got dressed noting that she would have to go shopping soon as nothing of hers fit her, so she had force an outfit on which exposed her chest and her glorious belly.

May walked to the front passing her dad who was drinking coffee and whisky mixed together. May opened the door to see Wally about to knock. “H-h-h-Hey May, I brought all of my things, including a tent and some sleeping bags. Wally said nervously and saw Max walking towards May. “Hey Max perfect timing. Max this is Wally Sapphire he’s going to be coming with us on our journey. Wally this is my little brother Max.” The two boys awkwardly greeting each, max understanding that Wally was forced into the situation but Max couldn’t really do anything about it.

After packing up and saying good bye to Norman, May, Max and Wally headed off to Petalburgh woods, Max and Wally pressed with the beautiful woods while May was just checking to see if there was any Pokemon good enough to eat but disappointed to see that it was mostly bug Pokemon, the least appetizing type. What happens now
1121322211121211.title: Wally is there waiting in the morning

choices: May tosses and turns in her sleep
May dreams that she is eating something
1121322211121213.content:
It was early in the morning, just after midnight, when Max began to stir awake from his slumber. Normally, he could never seem to recall his dreams, and he usually never had a problem with nightmares in the past. However, that was exactly the reason why he had woken up in the first place. Like how his life was slowly becoming more and more centered around his big sister May, know even his sleep was not free from his clutches.

The Nightmare was about May, so big and large she was basically a living, breathing apocalypse of gluttony and hunger. Her appetite was insatiable, gleefully glutting down on entire forests full of Pokemon and cities full of people. Yet the scariest things about it was how Max, from the safety of her shoulder, kept cheering her on and was excited to see his big sister get even fatter. The dream ended with May facing down Groudon, Rayquaza, and Kyogre before the first blow could be thrown.

Max, now awake, yawned and raised his arms over his head to stretch. Or, at least he would have, had his mouth not been filled with May’s sweaty back flab the moment he opened his mouth, and his arms not pinned down to the mattress on the floor by her incredible weight. For a few minutes, he didn’t know what was going on, until he rationalized that May had fallen asleep on him.
